This market reminded me that trading isnâ€™t about being busy, itâ€™s about being precise. I joined Bitget with the goal of growing my #BGB , but the sideways price action quickly showed how easy it is to slip into bad habits when conditions arenâ€™t clear. Reacting too fast and relying on market direction alone led to mistakes I didnâ€™t need to make.  Going into this new phase on Bitget, my focus is different. Iâ€™m trading calmer, waiting for confirmation, and choosing quality setups over constant action. Switching between spot and futures helps me stay flexible without forcing trades, and tools like GetAgent make it easier to filter out noise. The aim now is simple: trade with discipline, stay consistent, and let results build  naturally instead of chasing them.   $HYPE  $ADA

Lighter Overtakes Hyperliquid in 30-Day Perps Volume as DEX Competition Heats Up  $LIT  has taken the lead in on-chain perpetuals trading volume over the past 30 days, recording ~$198B, surpassing $HYPE  s ~$166B, according to DeFiLlama. Aster also moved ahead with $174B, highlighting intensifying competition among top perp DEXs.  The surge in Lighterâ€™s activity follows the launch of its LIT token, including a 25% community airdrop, zero taker fees for most users, and rapid TVL growth to $1.43B. Monthly momentum has now extended beyond short-term volume spikes seen earlier in 2025.  Despite losing the volume lead, Hyperliquid still dominates in key metrics: Open interest: $7.3B vs Lighterâ€™s $1.4B Spot volume: $4.8B vs $3.59B Annualized revenue: ~$820M vs ~$105M  Together, Lighter, Hyperliquid, and Aster generated $972B in on-chain perps volume over the last month, underscoring rapid growth in decentralized derivatives heading into 2026.  #lighter  #LIT  #HYPE  #HyperLiquid

$LIT  recorded ~$198B in monthly perpetuals trading, surpassing $HYPE â€™s ~$166B, driven by the LIT token launch, zero taker fees, and rapid TVL growth, according to Crypto News.  Despite the flip, Hyperliquid still leads in open interest, spot volume, and revenue - keeping the perp DEX rivalry wide open.  #HYPE  #HyperLiquid

Lighter Overtakes Hyperliquid in 30-Day Perps Volume as DEX Competition Heats Up

 $LIT has taken the lead in on-chain perpetuals trading volume over the past 30 days, recording ~$198B, surpassing   $HYPE s ~$166B, according to DeFiLlama. Aster also moved ahead with $174B, highlighting intensifying competition among top perp DEXs.

The surge in Lighter's activity follows the launch of its LIT token, including a 25% community airdrop, zero taker fees for most users, and rapid TVL growth to $1.43B. Monthly momentum has now extended beyond short-term volume spikes seen earlier in 2025.

Despite losing the volume lead, Hyperliquid still dominates in key metrics:
Open interest: $7.3B vs Lighter's $1.4B
Spot volume: $4.8B vs $3.59B
Annualized revenue: ~$820M vs ~$105M

Together, Lighter, Hyperliquid, and Aster generated $972B in on-chain perps volume over the last month, underscoring rapid growth in decentralized derivatives heading into 2026.

#lighter #LIT #HYPE #HyperLiquid

$LIT recorded ~$198B in monthly perpetuals trading, surpassing  $HYPE's ~$166B, driven by the LIT token launch, zero taker fees, and rapid TVL growth, according to Crypto News.

Despite the flip, Hyperliquid still leads in open interest, spot volume, and revenue keeping the perp DEX rivalry wide open.

#HYPE #HyperLiquid
